relation: The campus offers a lot of games, guest speakers, exhibits, clubs, sports, plays, and other activities for students.
The dining commons provide a variety of different foods. There is also a Subway, Panda Express, and Starbucks.
From what I have seen the dorms look great, however I have never lived in them.
Like I said the one-on-one time with professors is great and there are many different opportunities to seek help or delve more deeply into the subjects one is interested in.
Get in touch with the departments of subjects you are interested in. They are the people you want to know and ask questions to.

Cal State East Bay is great for people who are interested in one-on-one time with your teachers. The classes are small and provide you the opportunity to have a more personal relationship with students and teachers. It is a great school for personal relationships among faculty, staff, and students.
pageTitle: California State University-East Bay (CSUEB) Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex

textAfterTable: Tips for prospective students Ask questions, lots and lots of questions. Believe me, they make everything much easier! Bang for the buck It's worth it, believe me. Am enjoying being here I am truly enjoying it here at CSUEB. I live on campus, so I have had the chance to get to know many students, and become friends with some great people. I joined a sorority, and have gone to all the events the school has held. I've even joined up for the Orientation team this summer to help show students what a great school it is! GET INVOLVED! Believe me, it's worth all the time spent. Am learning a lot I have learned a lot in the 10 weeks that I have attended so far. The class sizes are nice, and I haven;t had much trouble getting the classes that I want. I have done well my first quarter, and I think I owe credit to CSUEB for that, Login to rate or flag the reviews Elmer from San Leandro, CA 07/18/2009 Reviewer
